title: Skin advantage was a real thing.
body:
"E - Electro Harpoon 
WHOOPS: Fixed a bug where the cooldown between Harpoon casts was shorter on Super Galaxy Rumble"
Skin advantage confirmed by rito

I like how people are getting mad over this and acting like its really a thing because they are bad and cant dodge skill shots its fine that you cant what makes you bad is your blaming a skin for it.

Visual contrast isn't an opinion...
no you thinking its hard to see is

I never said I thought it was hard to see.  There is opinion here, and there is fact.

You would be correct in suggesting that whether or not these spells are *too* difficult to see is opinion.

But visual clarity and contrast are easily measurable things, so we can do a pretty good job in this day and age of making measurements of how difficult things are to see.

Unfortunately I can't know your specific intent when you say "thats opinion" but I felt it useful to bring some detail and clarity into the conversation, although I will say I'm not downvoting you, because, like i said, i don't really know your intentions.

Short vague response that disproves your real argument, because it's an opinion.
(seriously I hate when people try to disprove a valid statement with "it's an opinion" or "you're wrong" or "that's just stupid."  Trying to get through to these people will never work)

They have little red telegraphs around things, I can imagine it being more challenging, but I wouldn't go so far as to say it is hard.

Did they add one to his minefield and q?  Regardless, it's just ARAM anyways.  Just pointing out some of the silliness (: The ghost skins can be said to have skin advantage as well, but I won't go there because that's a long stretch.

> underworld {{champion:4}} Q changes the cards making them spin in a strange way that slightly increases successful Q's

Not sure about the rest but that one is untrue, the spinning effect is solely visual and has no affect on the projectiles hitbox.

But players rely on the visuals to infer where the hitbox is.
A difference in visuals *can* make a skillshot easier or harder to dodge if the player trying to dodge haven't memorized the actual hitbox of the ability
See: Ghost Bride vs Classic Morgana binding projectile. Classic has a dark glob advance at you. Ghost Bride has a freakin' bus.

None of those are real advantages the skins with sun glasses reduce 1 point of damage.... 1 ....a whole 1 point from solar flare which isn't meant to damage anyway the rest are just you not following piccolo's advice. super galaxy rumble had a cooldown reduction on his abilities because of a skin...you know...cooldowns those things that get tweaked every now and then to keep the game balanced. completely different.
...wait, they actually get a damage reduction? I don't care if it's just one point, that shouldn't be a thing.

And Zyra gets a model size increase when the sunlight hits her! Plus, her SKT T1 Zyra skin has Sunglasses also! It's these fun little in game tidbits that keep things well... fun! Like "This unit is a flippin' ninja." :'C
Are you really going to argue that? Nobody goes out of their way to put on a skin with sun glasses to avoid that 1 dmg anyways.
I'm sure nobody does it, it's just a precedent that I don't like having in the game.
Why, it's not going to make a difference. Ever.

Tell me you can confidently say that 1 point of damage has never EVER saved someone from death, and I'll tell you it's okay to be in bronze.  I'm not saying this is very significant, I'm just saying that you cannot say that it has never once saved someone's life against a Leona, seeings how League has probably 10s of millions of games played.  I escape people with 2-3 health all the time.  I'm sure someone has lived against Leona just because of that little bit.

First of all, they need a skin with sunglasses. Second of all, they need to be against a Leona. Thirdly, they need to be in a situation where they escape with 2-3 hp. It will happen eventually, but not enough that it will ever matter (like maybe once every decade).

Once in a decade....so what you're saying is it's a 1 in several billion chance that 1 health will save you?  You can't have been playing that long.  I literally cannot tell you how many times I've lived with so few health a minion autoattack could kill me.  1 kill can mean the difference between winning a game, and losing it, if the opposing player who secures said kill or gets the assist is slightly better than you.  Just a little gold can push someone far enough ahead that you have a very difficult time recovering.

Once every decade?  Try probably more like once a day.
They also need to own the skin and be up against a Leona.... And a minion aa actually does quite a bit more than 2-3 damage.
You're still not seeing the point.  I'm not saying it's a game changing mechanic, I'm saying that it DOES save lives sometimes.

Because if they ever do something slightly bigger, they can point to sunglasses and say "Hey, this existed and nobody had a problem with it! Why is it an issue now, but not then?" *Highly* unlikely to ever happen, but it could. This being in the game gives Riot precedent if they ever decide to let skins make a bigger difference.
Riot has a habit of not doing that, it's the players that usually do it.

EDIT: All joking aside, I've heard in the past that Blood Lord Vladimir's animations are a bit deceiving due to alignment, BUT, I don't know how true this is or if maybe Riot fixed it, as I've only been against this skin once (and I didn't lane with him, and post-roaming stage didn't last very long).

And then let's not forget about the skins which bring opposite affects, such as...
1. Forecast Janna, one of my most regrettable champions, which adds a shit ton of contrast and color change to her whirlwind.  Might as well have Christmas lights in the mix.
2. Myrmidon Pantheon pretty much screams LOOK AT ME (golden mantheon)

4. Ninja Rammus makes you hate yourself for buying one of the worst skins.  It looks cool on the model viewer, but in-game looks like someone draped a purple sheet over him.  It's such a shame too.  Just get a refund and buy Full Metal Rammus, you won't be sorry.
